conclusion: Consider forces on each segment of the wire separately due to the magnetic field.
Segment AB is in a magnetic field pointing inward (out of the page).
Force on segment AB, \( \vec{F_{AB}} = I \cdot \vec{L_{AB}} \times \vec{B} \), results in a downward force.
Magnitude of force on AB is \( F_{AB} = IBL \).
Segment BC is in a magnetic field pointing outward (into the page).
Force on segment BC, \( \vec{F_{BC}} = I \cdot \vec{L_{BC}} \times \vec{B} \), results in a downward force.
Magnitude of force on BC is \( F_{BC} = IBL \).
Total force \( \vec{F_{total}} \) is the sum of \( \vec{F_{AB}} \) and \( \vec{F_{BC}} \), both downward.
Magnitude of total force is \( F_{total} = 2IBL \).
